meanings.definition: To become accustomed to a new climate or environment.
meanings.sent1: The plant slowly acclimates to the sunny weather.
meanings.sent2: She acclimates quickly to the cold temperatures.
meanings.sent3: The cat acclimates to the new house by exploring every corner.
meanings.sent4: Like a chameleon, he acclimates to any social setting effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The student acclimates to the early morning routine by setting multiple alarms.

meanings.definition: To adjust or adapt to a new situation or surroundings.
meanings.sent1: The team acclimates to the coach's new strategy.
meanings.sent2: He acclimates well to the fast-paced work environment.
meanings.sent3: The robot acclimates to its programming flawlessly.
meanings.sent4: She acclimates to change like a seasoned professional.
meanings.sent5: The puppy acclimates to the leash by wagging its tail happily.
